"The Odyssey" is a classic novel about the journey of Odysseus and his crew through the Greek underworld back to his kingdom of Ithaka.

"The Odyssey" is written by Homer in ancient Greece around 800 BCE. 

Homer was an ancient Greek poet who lived in the 8th century BCE. He is best known for writing the Iliad, a long epic poem which tells the story of the Trojan War between the Greeks and the Trojans.

Based on your preference cues, I would recommend two movies from your list:
1. "Divergent" (2014) - Starring: Rachel Ticotin, Marc Anthony, Radha Mitchell, Radha Mitchell, Giancarlo Giannini, Giancarlo Giannini, Denzel Washington, Denzel Washington
This movie follows the story of Tris, a young woman who discovers that she's Divergent, meaning that she has traits of more than one faction. When she learns about the dangers of being Divergent, Tris and her friends embark on a dangerous journey to uncover the secrets behind the different factions in this world.
2. "The Secret" (1992) - Starring: Genevieve O'Reilly, Ash Cook, James Nesbitt
This movie follows the story of a stranger who enters into and forever alters the life of a couple. He claims to be pursued by certain authorities who intend to prevent him from disclosing a secret that only he holds, whence the title.
Is he lying, or insane  - or is he telling the truth? Who, if anyone, is after him? And what  *is*  - the secret?
In this movie, you can see how the stranger's actions and words affect the life of the couple. You can also see how the authorities' intentions to prevent the stranger from disclosing a secret that only he holds, affect the life of the couple.
Overall, both movies have unique stories and themes that are worth exploring.
